snippet: After a week of record-breaking storms in Larimer and Boulder Counties, many people were still reported unaccounted for, but officials said they hoped those people had simply lost contact.
abstract: Record-breaking rain storms continue in Colorado's Larimer and Boulder Counties, hobbling efforts to rescue hundreds of people who remain stranded in flooded mountains; storms have left six people dead or presumed dead, while more than 800 remain unaccounted for.
lead_paragraph: After a week of record-breaking storms in Larimer and Boulder Counties, many people were still reported unaccounted for, but officials said they hoped those people had simply lost contact.

headline.main: More Rain in Colorado Frustrates Rescue Efforts
headline.print_headline: Rain Returns to Flooded Colorado, Frustrating Efforts to Rescue Stranded
